intro: Commiphora brevicalyx subsp. vezorum, commonly known as the African myrrh, is a small evergreen tree native to parts of eastern Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic resinous sap, which has been used traditionally for medicinal and incense purposes. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in dry or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and its flowers are small and inconspicuous, with yellowish-green petals. The tree produces a fragrant gum that is harvested for its therapeutic properties.
